title: [K-12] Development and Application of Real-World Mathematics-Based Problem-Solving Worksheets

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary-level mathematics concepts (functions, geometry, statistics, etc.), basic problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Utilizing realistic math worksheets that combine flipped learning with problem-based learning in smartphone-centric constrained technology environments.

learning_goals: Students can systematically analyze and solve complex problems using realistic math worksheets.
Students can achieve over 80% comprehension of mathematical concepts through interactive activities with online flipbooks.

In team-based problem-solving activities (4 members per team), learners solve three given mathematical problems, propose at least two creative solutions through role division and idea sharing, and submit a report meeting at least two of three collaboration rubric criteria: communication, participation, and respect.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
